review: Settle back for a rambling little whodunit that tells its tale with style and (usually) loving humor. Revel in the characters who people the town of Holly Springs.  Savor the details in the set decorations. Cherish this little gem. Lyle Lovett stands out in a (mostly silent) role that's almost a cameo. But everyone is terrific, although Glenn Close plays the character of Camille almost -- but not quite -- over the top and too broadly.
